title: (x) 'Slav' bold sans w/ rounded corners & single storey a - Garage Gothic {Yves}
content:
This is from a designer’s website (sorry I don’t have the name), any ideas about the type?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203185915im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/slavposter_3928.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Chiro-chiseled semiserif in Karastan Brochure - Gilgamesh {Florian}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203185915/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39197 "Go to previous forum topic") [Army of Darkness condensed serif face ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203185915/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39314 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jameslangdon

comments.content:
I’m glad this has come up because when I browse the FB site I’ve always passed this one up. Seeing it in use helps me visualize a use for it.

Mikey :-)

_This is from a designer’s website (sorry I don’t have the name)_

That would be Kasia Korczak in collaboration with writer/artist Payam Sharifi. Arnhem, Netherlands. Spring 2006. [http://www.kasia-korczak.com/slavposter/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203185915/http:/www.kasia-korczak.com/slavposter/index.html "http://www.kasia-korczak.com/slavposter/index.html")

Mikey - It was also used very nicely by Graven Images for [Crema coffee](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203185915/http:/www.graven.co.uk/work.aspx?n=2-8&id=180#180).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203185915im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Crema-Colombian-Marsella_5878.jpg)
